channel.title: Fixing the map back
channel.description:
alright i fixed the flames on my client (for those who were wondering the same thing just find method58 and delete everything but this:
[code] method58 { } [/code]
this was all i had to do but it may be different for you anyways->) my map back is the wierd brown thing that runescape used to use but it doesn't match the rest of the theme of my client at all... the client theme is green and black and then there's one square that is the ugly brown color.. i've had clients where it matched before but i can't figure out how to change it now.. if somone could help me that would be awesome...[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2009, 11:59:24 pm[/size][hr]oh.. forgot to mention.. the method 58 part is in the client.java of your client

item.title: Fixing the map back
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“Impulse Arrow, post:2, topic:254475”]Ok Easy…

Go into the Icons in your client folder… The same ones as how you change the background, change the color of the Map and then compile your client.[/quote]
if it’s not a .jag file
if it is just open it with paint

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing the map back
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ok Easy…

Go into the Icons in your client folder… The same ones as how you change the background, change the color of the Map and then compile your client.

@Pkman411 wrote:

alright i fixed the flames on my client (for those who were wondering the same thing just find method58 and delete everything but this:

method58
{
}

this was all i had to do but it may be different for you anyways->) my map back is the wierd brown thing that runescape used to use but it doesn’t match the rest of the theme of my client at all… the client theme is green and black and then there’s one square that is the ugly brown color… i’ve had clients where it matched before but i can’t figure out how to change it now… if somone could help me that would be awesome…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2009, 11:59:24 pm[/size][hr]oh… forgot to mention… the method 58 part is in the client.java of your client
